cyclone.name: MATTHEW
cyclone.current_location: about 70 mi SSE of Savannah, Georgia
cyclone.trajectory: moving north along the Georgia coast, expected to turn north-northeast then northeast and skirt the coasts of South Carolina and southern North Carolina before heading seaward
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: near or just south of Cape Fear, NC (close pass to Wilmington)

weather_observation.watch_coast: North of Surf City to Cape Lookout, NC
weather_observation.warning_coast: North of Fernandina Beach, FL to Surf City, NC (includes Wilmington area)
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Volusia/Brevard County line, FL to Duck, NC
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm force winds likely; 36% chance of sustained 50-kt, 10% chance of hurricane-force (64-kt) winds at the port.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Potential 5–7 ft surge in the Cape Fear–Wilmington area if peak surge coincides with high tide.
weather_observation.rainfall: 8–12 inches with isolated 15 inches possible, producing life-threatening flash flooding.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Dangerous surf and rip currents, possible isolated tornadoes along the coastal plain.
